Soal Mafia Beras BPNT, Buwas Sebut Ada Temuan Baru
01 Nov 2019, 11:12 by Eko Wahyudi, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Direktur Utama Perum Bulog Budi Waseso atau Buwas mengatakan, penanganan mafia penyaluran beras Bantuan Pangan Non Tunai (BPNT) masih berlanjut. Dia mengungkapkan, saat ini ada temuan terbaru terkait kasus tersebut, namun dirinya belum bisa bercerita lebih jauh.
Budi Waseso enggan mengungkapkan temuan baru itu karena menyerahkan sepenuhnya penanganan kasus ini kepada Satuan Tugas (Satgas) Pangan Kepolisian RI. "Saya kira ada, karena informasi kemarin ada temuan-temuan baru dari Satgas. Karena saya hanya melaporkan dan bukti awal yang pertama, dan pembuktian semuanya akan diberikan kepada Satgas," kata Buwas di Kementerian BUMN, Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Dia mengungkapkan, saat ini anggota Satgas Pangan telah menyebar ke seluruh daerah yang terindikasi ada mafia BPNT untuk memeriksa temuan-temuan mereka. Buwas menuturkan, dirinya tidak boleh terlibat lagi dan harus percaya dengan Kepolisian.
"Karena saya enggak boleh ikut campur lagi, kita harus percaya dengan Polisi, masa pensiunan Polisi tidak percaya dengan Polisi," ucapnya.
Buwas menjelaskan, selama ini dirinya hanya menjalankan tugas dari Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi. Menurut Presiden, dalam penyaluran BPNT itu berasnya dari Bulog. "Itu yang saya pegang," tambahnya.
Adapun keputusan Menteri Sosial yang terdahulu dinilainya telah mengakibatkan kesalahan fatal dalam penyaluran BPNT. Akibatnya, banyak oknum yang menerima uang panas dari pelaksanaan program tersebut.
"Karena di lapangan banyak kepentingan-kepentingan, karena di sana banyak oknum-oknum dari Kepala Dinas yang tidak ikhlas. ada yang ngomong Bulog pengemis lah, ayam sayur lah, dan sekarang sudah ditangani oleh Kepolisian," ucap Buwas
Buwas mengaku tidak ingin hanya bermulut besar saja, namun dirinya ingin membuktikan apa yang sebenarnya terjadi di lapangan. Karena penyaluran BPNT ini menyangkut kepentingan banyak orang."Saya tidak hanya ngomong saya harus berusaha bagaiman untuk menghilangkan ini," ujar dia.

Regarding BPNT Mafia Rice, Buwas Said There Are New Findings
01 Nov 2019, 11:12 by Eko Wahyudi, Rahma Tri
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Bulog President Director Budi Waseso or Buwas said, the handling of the Non-Cash Food Aid (BPNT) mafia distribution of rice is continuing. He revealed, currently there are the latest findings related to the case, but he could not tell further.
Budi Waseso was reluctant to reveal the new findings because he had fully submitted the handling of this case to the Indonesian Police's Food Task Force. "I think there is, because yesterday's information there were new findings from the Task Force. Because I only reported and the first preliminary evidence, and all evidence will be given to the Task Force," Buwas said at the SOE Ministry, Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019.
He revealed that currently the members of the Food Task Force had spread to all regions indicated that there was a BPNT mafia to examine their findings. Buwas said, he could not be involved anymore and had to trust the Police.
"Because I can't interfere again, we have to trust the Police, the retired Police don't trust the Police," he said.
Buwas explained, so far he only carried out the duties of President Joko Widodo or Jokowi. According to the President, in the distribution of BPNT the rice came from Bulog. "That's what I hold," he added.
The decision of the Minister of Social Affairs which he previously considered had resulted in a fatal error in the distribution of BPNT. As a result, many elements received hot money from the implementation of the program.
"Because in the field there are many interests, because there are many elements from the Head of Service who are not sincere. There are those who talk about Bulog, beggars, vegetable chicken, and now it has been handled by the Police," said Buwas
Buwas admitted that he did not want to just have a big mouth, but he wanted to prove what really happened on the ground. Because the distribution of BPNT concerns the interests of many people, "I am not just talking about how I should try to eliminate this," he said.
